email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Pie Chart of Last Week's Biscuit Vote
image.title: Thanks for voting, people who care about the biscuit <3!

email.text:
Hello everyone,
Welcome to another week of the DoCSoc digest!
This week, we bring you a Microsoft Cognitive Services workshop and UROP 101!
**Also, you can sign up for our very own Valentine's Service, only until 23.59 on Thursday 8th February. If there is someone special who you would like to send a rose and message to, [sign up here](https://docsoc.co.uk/valentines).**
Last week, over 70 of you voted and decided the future of the biscuit. From now on, the bottom of the digest will include a link to a form where biscuits for the next week may be suggested. The biscuit that we send out remains at the discretion of the DoCSoc committee, but your suggestions should really help. Plus, we'll credit you for the suggestion next to the biscuit form link!
email.heading: Microsoft Cognitive Services: Hands On Workshop

event.text:
Come along to learn about Microsoft Cognitive Services, including the Custom Vision AI Service. After learning about these services, there will be a hands on workshop so you can see for yourself how easy it is to build and deploy your projects using these services!
All experience levels welcome and please make sure you bring your laptop with you. Food and drink will be provided at the event and there will also be giveaways!

email.heading: UROP 101
Docker Workshop

event.text:
Docker is a tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers. Containers allow a developer to package up an application with all of the parts it needs, such as libraries and other dependencies, and ship it all out as one package.
This workshop is targeted to those who want to learn about the basics of Docker. If you are taking Distributed Algorithms (CO347), this workshop will definitely help you with the course. You may also encounter Docker in some format during a placement or internship this summer..
This workshop will be hosted by Abhinav Mishra.

email.heading: The Valentine's Bar Night

event.text:
It's time for the first Bar Night of 2018! Once again, we'll be meeting in Metric at 7pm for an evening of free drinks and great conversation.
Drinks tokens will be given upon entry for FREE to any member of DoCSoc. Tokens are valid for both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

email.heading: Internship 101
JetBrains: Kotlin Hands-On
DoCSoc hosts Google Hash Code
IC HealthHack 2018
3Hack 2.0

event.text:
This is an open-ended hackathon focused on bringing together students interested in one of the 3 major areas: graphic designing, entrepreneurship, and engineering/programming to create something new while building connections with one another.
Coming alone on the day of the hack? Not to worry, we can help you form a team on the day. Don't worry if you lack experience, we will have plenty of mentors to help and take this opportunity as a chance to learn! Not only is it a great chance to create something special, but one to network with our mentors/organisers which consists of Microsoft seniors, Internet entrepreneurs, successful mobile-app developers and students from other societies.
Organised by Microsoft Student Partners of Imperial College London.

email.sign:
That's all for now!
Until next time,
email.text: This week's biscuit brought to you by: Biscuit Voters! [Submit Biscuit](https://docsoc.co.uk/suggest-biscuit).
